articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Panetta: Killing Soleimani 'wasn't debated' during my time at...
articles.description: "There was understandable concern that if you try and go after and kill a high-ranking general in a country like Iran that you're going to increase the risk of war," former Defense Secretary Leon Panetta says.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Panetta: U.S. has 'dropped the ball' in the Middle East
articles.description: "We should've developed a coalition of forces ... made up of moderate countries," former Defense Secretary Leon Panetta says.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Menendez: Too early to judge whether killing Soleimani has...
articles.description: Sen. Bob Menendez (D-N.J.) says "we'll have to see" if the proxy groups in Iraq "act or don't act."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: U.S. and Iran each appear to step back from further military escalation
articles.description: President Trump appeared to head towards de-escalation to avert a rapidly accelerating standoff with Iran

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rhodes on Trump’s accusation the Obama administration funded the Iranian missiles: ‘We’re better than this, our politics should be better than this’
articles.description: Former deputy national security adviser for President Obama and former Senator Claire McCaskill on Trump using his an announcement on Iran to accuse his predecessor of funding the missiles launched by the Iranians

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Mike Lee slams Trump administration briefing on Iran
articles.description: Sen. Mike Lee (R-Utah) calls the Iran briefing "the worst" he's ever seen in his nine years in the Senate.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Wednesday's Mini-Report, 1.8.20
articles.content:
Today’s edition of quick hits:
* Plane crash in Iran: A Ukrainian airplane carrying 176 people crashed after takeoff in Tehran on Wednesday, killing all on board the Boeing 737-800, according to Ukrainian officials…. It is unclear how the plane went down, bu… [+2148 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOP Sen. Lee: Distressing Iran attack briefing was worst he's seen in nearly a decade
articles.description: GOP Senator Mike Lee expresses his displeasure with the briefing about the Iran missile attack, calling it the "worst briefing I've seen, at least on a military issue, in the nine years I've served in the United States Senate." Nicolle Wallace, responding to …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What was the White House strategy on Iran?
articles.description: While President Trump seems to be standing down on further military action against Iran, the question of ‘why’ the White House isn’t retaliating remains. Deputy Director of Studies at the Center for a New American Security, Loren Dejonge Schulman,  and Hagar …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Top Trump aides briefing Congress on Iran as Tehran retaliates
articles.description: The President's strategy on Iran. Does he have one? Washington Post Foreign Columnist and Associate Editor David Ignatius, and Intercept Senior Contributor Mehdi Hassan join Katy Tur to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Rooney discusses today’s House Briefing
articles.description: Florida's Francis Rooney, a Republican in Congress, joins Katy Tur to discuss today’s House briefing.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What was accomplished by Iran’s missile strikes?
articles.description: Ali Velshi talks about the message Iran was trying to send with its strikes on Iraqi bases that house U.S. troops with Ian Bremmer, president of the geopolitical risk firm Eurasia Group.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Bergman: Israel Avoided The “Circle of Revenge”
articles.description: Despite being one of the most dangerous terrorists in the world, past presidents and American allies declined to target Iran’s Quassem Soleimani, despite multiple opportunities. Ronen Bergman, New York Times Magazine writer and author of "Rise and Kill First:…
